page.title: 14Architectural Heritage
page.content: Manor Farm: Next to the Church, the original building was a priory and parsonage. The extant dwelling is mainly Elizabethan. There is l5th Century glass inserted into the fabric, apparently to save it during the Reformation. Long Sutton House: The largest house in the area. Parts of the house date from the Tudor period. A magnificent mews was converted to a carriage house, and is now an annexe. The garden was designed by Paxton. Manor House Farm: A good example of domestic architecture. The house and environs were used by the forces of Charles, Cromwell and Monmouth. The House was connected to the Court House by an underground passage.
